intro: Clidemia lugubris, commonly known as the mourning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its showy, violet to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a rough texture. Clidemia lugubris is known for its rapid growth and ability to spread through both seeds and vegetative propagation.
